https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A characterization of a reservoir that incorporates all the characteristics of the reservoir that are pertinent to its ability to store hydrocarbons and also to produce them. Reservoir characterization models are used to simulate the behaviour of the fluids within the reservoir under different sets of circumstances and to find the optimal production techniques that will maximize the production. Typically, a reservoir analysis incorporates interpretation of depositional facies and diagenesis, mineralogical and textural maturity parameters obtained from macro/meso (e.g. cores, sidewall cores, cuttings) and micro (e.g. thin sections, scanning electron microscope work) samples, as well as direct and indirect measurements of porosity, permeability and grain density from well log analysis and core and mechanical sidewall cores. Image logs are used to determine fracture density where applicable. Regional reservoir distribution and thickness is derived from multiple well reservoir data, seismic interpretation and depth mapping.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and AAPG Wiki (https://wiki.aapg.org/).
